Title:
A new species and four new records of Amanita (Amanitaceae;
Basidiomycota) from Northern Thailand
Abstract:
Mushrooms belonging to the genus Amanita were collected
during a fungal biodiversity study in northern Thailand in 2012Â–2014.
Morphological characteristics and molecular phylogenetic analyses were
used to identify the mushrooms to species. Amanita castanea is described
as new to science and compared with similar species. Four other species,
A. concentrica, A. rimosa, A. rubromarginata and A. zangii are recorded
here as first reports for Thailand.
